data.title: IN THE HALL OF THE MARTIAN KINGS: SCIENCE FICTION ..

data.text:
Varley, John.

London: Sidgwick & Jackson, [1978]. Octavo, boards. First British edition. Varley's first collection of short stories. Published earlier in the U.S. as THE PERSISTENCE OF VISION (1978). "The sentimental title story ["Persistance of Vision"] (Hugo and Nebula Awards winner, 1979) concerns a colony of blind folk who develop amazing powers. Most of the rest are tales set in a bioengineered space-faring human society of the not-to-distant future. Fast and inventive, they are carried off with astonishing aplomb." "...it was the stories reprinted in this book which brought him acclaim." - Pringle, The Ultimate Guide to Science Fiction, second edition (1995), pp. 277-278. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1171. Spine ends bruised, a nearly fine copy in a nearly fine price clipped dust jacket with publisher's price label affixed to upper front panel, with mild wear to spine ends and corner tips, mild crease along lower front panel. (29321). Item #29321
